subject: Re: [junit] How to isolate units with calls to static methods or on objects locally created?

messageBody:
javamockit wrote:
> Consider you want to unit test the following method:
>
> public int doBusinessOp(Data data) {
> ...
> int sum = new ServiceX().addItems(data.getItems());
> ...
> }
>
> Without changing doBusinessOp, how would you isolate it from the
> dependency on class ServiceX?
>
> I recently created a small tool that allows such tests to be written.
> It seems the only other way would be to use AspectJ or one of the
> XML-based AOP frameworks.
>
> With the new tool you could write (in a JUnit TestCase):
>
> public void testDoBusinessOp() {
> Mockit.redefineMethods(ServiceX.class, new Object() {
> public int addItems(List items) {
> assertNotNull(items); return 0;
> }
> });
>
> ... create data, call doBusinessOp, assert result ...
> }
>
> Project home page at jmockit.dev.java.net.
>
> What do you think?

This is quite neat. Could you please put in big, red letters on the site
that this is strictly a legacy code technique, and that people should
try to refactor away from using the tool as quickly as possible?

Another great tool for adding tests to code. I think I can use this
tomorrow.
